creator: sebastian.wolfgarten@gmx.net
text:
Hi,

I have just tried to install the latest cvs snapshot of apache 2.0 and
it compiles without any problems. When I try to do a "make install" it fails 
with this message:
if [ ! -d /usr/local/apache2/include ]; then \
    /home/sebastian/apachenew/httpd-
2.0/srclib/apr/build/mkdir.sh /usr/local/apache2/include; \
fi;
cp /home/sebastian/apachenew/httpd-
2.0/srclib/apr/include/*.h /usr/local/apache2/include;
cp /include/*.h /usr/local/apache2/include;
cp: cannot stat `/include/*.h': No such file or directory
make[2]: *** [install] Error 1

"cp /include/*.h" is wrong in my opinion, it should be "include/*.h".
So I made a symbolic link "ln -s /home/sebastian/apachenew/httpd-
2.0/include/ /include" and "make install" now works without any problems.
Maybe someout could fix this.

Bye, Sebastian

I think you grabbed CVS at a bad moment.  A new release is due out any
time now.  Please give that a try and reopen this bug if your problem is
still there.
